newsitem.title: UK: SOCCER-LIVERPOOL HELD TO 1-1 BY CHARLTON IN LEAGUE CUP.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-LIVERPOOL HELD TO 1-1 BY CHARLTON IN LEAGUE CUP.

text.p: English premier league side Liverpool were forced into a third round League Cup replay on Wednesday after they were held to 1-1 draw by first division Charlton.

Arsenal, currently second in the league, were also held to a draw by another first division side, Stoke. Striker Mike Sheron's 11th goal of the season rocked the London side before Ian Wright snatched a late-equaliser to save Arsenal from an embarrassing exit.
League leaders Newcastle were pushed to the limit by bottom-of-the-first-division Oldham, relying on Peter Beardsley's 25th minute penalty to carry them through to fourth round.

Manchester United also had their anxious moments against Swindon, another first division outfit, with the score locked at 1-1 until Paul Scholes' 72nd minute winner. They now play Leicester in the fourth round.
Striker David Whyte stunned Liverpool with a cheekily-taken 18th minute goal to give first division strugglers Charlton the lead at The Valley.
Carl Leaburn nudged on a long through-ball and Whyte delicately lifted it over goalkeeper David James.
Manchester United made eight changes to the side who crashed 5-0 in the league at Newcastle on Sunday and were made to sweat in their 2-1 win over first division Swindon at Old Trafford.
One of the few players to keep his place was Czech winger Karel Poborsky, who gave United a 19th-minute lead.
Former Blackburn striker Peter Thorne hit back for Swindon before Scholes soothed United's worries.

Middlesbrough were by far the most impressive of the top flight sides crushing Huddersfield 5-1 thanks to two goals by Fabrizio Ravanelli and others from Danish international Mikkel Beck and Brazilians Juninho and Emerson. They now face Newcastle in mouth-watering fourth round tie.
In other results holders Aston Villa set up a showdown with either Wimbledon or Luton after coming from behind to beat Leeds 2-1.
Tottenham outplayed Sunderland 2-1 to set up a fourth round tie with Bolton.
